title: Yankees Overcome 6-1 Deficit to Beat Blue Jays 9-6, Force ALDS Game 4
snippets: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. had his moment in Toronto. Aaron Judge answered Tuesday night in New York.
Louis Varland will take the ball for the Toronto Blue Jays to begin a bullpen game on Wednesday.
Aaron Judge gave the New York Yankees a jolt with a unique three-run home run as they completed a comeback to defeat the Toronto Blue Jays 9-6 in Game 3 of their American League Division Series.

The New York Yankees have forced a Game 4 against the Blue Jays after defeating Toronto 9-6 in Game 3 of the American League Divisional Series (ALDS). The Blue Jays got up to an early 6-1 lead in the third inning before the Yankees rallied back. Game 4 will be at Yankee Stadium Wednesday at 7:08 [&#
Blue Jays Central panel discusses if Blue Jays’ Shane Bieber was pulled too early in Game 3 against the Yankees.
titles: Blue Jays drop 9-6 decision to Yankees in Game 3
Blue Jays’ Louis Varland to start Game 4 vs. Yankees
MLB Game 3 Highlights: Yankees 9, Blue Jays 6
Toronto Blue Jays give up early lead as Yankees force Game 4 with 9-6 victory
Did Blue Jays take Bieber out of Game 3 too early?
summary: The New York Yankees defeated the Toronto Blue Jays 9-6 in Game 3 of the ALDS, overcoming an early 6-1 deficit. The discussion centers on whether Blue Jays' Shane Bieber was pulled too early by manager John Schneider. The Yankees' victory forces a Game 4 at Yankee Stadium.

title: Sullivan's Rangers Debut Ends in 3-0 Loss to Penguins
snippets: Mike Sullivan, a former New York assistant hired to be the next Rangers head coach in the offseason, made his debut Tuesday night at Madison Square Garden, but his former team, the Pittsburgh Penguins, stole the show and skated off with a 3-0 victory.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMikAFBVV95cUxPTVJYNGZBeFJ1bEZvbWdiUm50LTlydDc3X0JJbm9aa2w4LXFra09tWUwzNkhYcjBueWQtNkpsTy02VUtFNktVSXMtZndLRG5rS2lXWEZZeG5XUktxeFM2T09SenFyX1NqM21EVmpjUjJIdERWdjE5YjhxRzhUVXN2YnM3OWJ6M0p2WmVOSTdsU1c?oc=5" target="_blank">Penguins spoil old coach Sulliva

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMikwFBVV95cUxQZmUteEx1b25neEdDZ1dEQ3N6Tm41YkhtMUZhMUlHRm02TlRQZDRHa3N2ekIxSVFLV0JrZExLdUZFN1dNM0U0bF96QU5RTGRnVi1LSU1KTE41M0JIcEtrY1hZZTUzVkFVN21HYXBIWDV5a3lQN3gzVFpLS0M4bUFhdXR1TlRGUGFMZGdnUTdhUEhwQzg?oc=5" target="_blank">Penguins at Rangers projecte

Justin Brazeau scored twice, Arturs Silovs stopped all 25 shots he faced for his first regular-season NHL shutout, and the Pittsburgh Penguins beat the New York Rangers 3-0 on Tuesday night in each team’s opener.
titles: Sullivan's debut as Rangers coach spoiled by Pens
Penguins spoil old coach Sullivan's Rangers debut with shutout win - NHL.com
Penguins at Rangers projected lineups - NHL.com
Penguins blank Rangers in coach Dan Muse’s debut
summary: Mike Sullivan, newly appointed as the Rangers head coach, faced defeat in his debut when the Pittsburgh Penguins won 3-0 against the New York Rangers at Madison Square Garden. Justin Brazeau scored twice for the Penguins, and Arturs Silovs achieved his first regular-season NHL shutout by stopping all 25 shots from the Rangers.

title: Ravens Trade Oweh to Chargers for Gilman, Draft Picks
snippets: The Ravens traded slumping pass rusher Odafe Oweh and a 2027 seventh-round pick to the Chargers on Tuesday in exchange for safety Alohi Gilman and a fifth-round pick in 2026, the teams announced.
The Harbaugh brothers pull off a trade

Ravens trade EDGE Odafe Oweh to Chargers for safety Alohi Gilman, late-round pick swap
Sliding Ravens Trade Linebacker Odafe Oweh to Chargers - Sports Illustrated
summary: The Baltimore Ravens have traded pass rusher Odafe Oweh and a 2027 seventh-round draft pick to the Los Angeles Chargers. In return, the Ravens received safety Alohi Gilman and a 2026 fifth-round pick. This trade was reported by ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: US Government Shutdown Delays Economic Reports; Asian Markets Closed for Holiday
snippets: Analysts point to delays in the reporting of economic data due to the US government shutdown as one reason for the rise.
Mainland China and South Korean markets are closed for the holidays.
Prices have doubled in less than two years as central banks stockpile bullion and investors pour in to gold funds
titles: Gold surges past $4,000 an ounce as uncertainty fuels rally
Spot gold prices hit $4,000 for the first time as global uncertainty fuels safe-haven demand
Gold price tops $4,000 for first time
summary: Due to the US government shutdown, there have been delays in reporting economic data, contributing to a rise in an unspecified context. Meanwhile, markets in Mainland China and South Korea are closed for holidays.

title: OMB: 2019 Back Pay Law Doesn't Cover Furloughed Workers Amid Shutdown
snippets: A new draft White House memo suggests a 2019 law signed by President Trump that guarantees that federal employees get paid after a shutdown ends would not apply to furloughed workers.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiiAFBVV95cUxPUS1lYl9GYkRZTWZLaTRhZ0dCMjg1SGJXUUpzdVpoUzdCTjB6VFpuUmpEX2lLMF82N0xtdURXZFY1aUtnZmZQN2FhWUc4ZjY1UWRsNldxaDJ3ZW9VZHJyU2xOeHFVUHliZXJ3OE1zY00tOVRjY1J5cnp6aWRObXhXakY3RFhwQktj?oc=5" target="_blank">Congress erupts over "lawless" Trump threat

As the federal shutdown stretches on, furloughed federal workers face the threat of not receiving back pay, despite a 2019 law that requires it.
titles: White House floats no back pay for some furloughed federal workers despite 2019 law
Congress erupts over "lawless" Trump threat not to pay back furloughed federal workers - Axios
Scoop: White House memo says furloughed federal workers aren't entitled to back pay - Axios
Furloughed federal workers face threat of no back pay from shutdown, despite 2019 law requiring it
summary: The White House's Office of Management and Budget (OMB) contends that a 2019 law ensuring federal employees receive back pay after a shutdown does not apply to furloughed workers. This interpretation has sparked controversy amid the ongoing government shutdown, leaving furloughed federal employees at risk of not getting back pay as previously guaranteed by the 2019 legislation.

title: Troops Enter Chicago Amid Legal Battles with City and State
snippets: Troops arrive despite active legal challenges from Chicago and the state of Illinois in the courts.

Military presence comes after judge declined to block troops from entering, following lawsuit filed by city and state

Texas national guard troops have arrived in the Chicago area, marking an escalation of
titles: US National Guard troops arrive in Illinois as Trump escalates crackdown
Photos: Texas National Guard troops arrive in Chicago area for Trump crackdown - Axios
Texas national guard troops arrive in Chicago amid Trump’s crackdown
summary: Troops have arrived in Chicago despite ongoing legal challenges from both the city and the state of Illinois. This development follows a judge's decision not to prevent the military's entry, a decision made in the context of a lawsuit brought by Chicago and Illinois.

title: Supreme Court Reviews State Power on Conversion Therapy Bans
snippets: The high court's conservative justices express concern the ban might infringe upon therapists' freedom of speech.
Supreme Court seems skeptical of conversion therapy ban&n

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihwFBVV95cUxOeFV5Q0JvZFFfYmdGV1hpd0VWdTBhTXpQU3gwaVZyMWxVQ1A4ejVHc21fbFhnTVR3OFE1ZlVUOTcxakRVWHdqOVBlUnMzMUhBZzRoVzJEa1paWUhsRnRFa1BTMmtPXzZIbEprQ1M1WjdmYUVXZHBtakFWaG5zQTVRVDA1cE9mSHc?oc=5" target="_blank">Supreme Court weighs case on conversion ther
California and 20 other states that forbid licensed counselors to practice 'conversion therapy' face a free-speech challenge.
titles: Conservative-led US Supreme Court seems wary of ‘conversion therapy’ ban
Supreme Court seems skeptical of conversion therapy ban - Axios
Supreme Court weighs case on conversion therapy for youth - Axios
Supreme Court sees a free-speech problem with laws that ban 'conversion therapy' for minors
summary: The Supreme Court is reviewing a case that examines if states have the authority to regulate conversations between counselors and clients, specifically focusing on the legality of conversion therapy bans. This case has ignited a conflict between conservative Christian groups and the LGBTQ+ community, with significant implications for both freedom of speech and the rights of LGBTQ+ individuals. The outcome is pending.

title: Tesla Launches Cheaper Model Y and 3, Prices Start at $36,990
snippets: Tesla debuts cheaper versions of Model Y and Model 3 electric vehicles&n
Newly announced trims still hover closer to $40,000 than $30,000 — a price that many investors view as putting the vehicle within mass-market reach.
The long-awaited cheaper Model 3 and Model Y are finally here, but they start at $36,990 and $39,990, respectively -- just a few thousand dollars less than Tesla's current offerings.
titles: Tesla debuts cheaper versions of Model Y and Model 3 electric vehicles - Axios
Tesla just unveiled a cheaper Model Y and Model 3. Why the stock is falling.
Tesla reveals slightly cheaper ‘standard’ versions of the Model 3 and Model Y
summary: Elon Musk announced Tesla will sell more affordable versions of the Model Y to meet high demand, acknowledging the current price is too high for many consumers. The cheaper trims of the Model Y and Model 3 are now available, starting at $39,990 and $36,990, respectively. These prices, while lower, remain closer to $40,000, slightly missing the mass-market target price of under $30,000 that investors hoped for.

title: Bondi Clashes with Democrats in Tense Senate Judiciary Hearing
snippets: Nerves were raw in a hearing that covered much ground, and saw Trump's attorney general go on the attack.
Democrats on the Senate panel grilled her over her leadership of the Justice Department. She hit back, with GOP support.
Bondi's testimony before the Senate Judiciary Committee devolved into personal attacks against Democrats, who expressed dismay at their inability to get her to answer their inquiries.
titles: Five takeaways from US Attorney General Pam Bondi's tense, partisan Senate hearing
US Attorney General Pam Bondi clashes with critics at key Senate hearing
Atty. Gen. Pam Bondi dodges Democrats' questions in combative Senate hearing
summary: During a tense Senate Judiciary Committee hearing, former Attorney General Pam Bondi aggressively responded to questions, leading to personal attacks against Democrats. Committee members expressed frustration over their inability to obtain answers from Bondi, indicating a contentious atmosphere throughout the session.

title: Yankee Stadium Crowd Boos "O Canada" Before ALDS Game 3
snippets: Loud boos were heard throughout Yankee Stadium as "O Canada" was played before Game 3 of the American League Division Series between the Toronto Blue Jays and New York Yankees.
Loud boos were heard throughout Yankee Stadium as “O Canada” was played before Game 3 of the American League Division Series between the Toronto Blue Jays and New York Yankees.
titles: Bronx Zoo: Loud boos for ‘O Canada’ before Game 3
Boos heard during ‘O Canada’ before Game 3 at Yankee Stadium
summary: Before Game 3 of the American League Division Series at Yankee Stadium, "O Canada," the national anthem of Canada, was met with loud boos from the crowd. The game featured the Toronto Blue Jays against the New York Yankees.

title: 900 Stranded on Everest's Chinese Side Rescued After Snowstorm
snippets: About 900 hikers, guides and other staff who were stranded by a weekend snowstorm on the Chinese side of Mount Everest have reached safety, state media said late Tuesday.
Those rescued included guides, yak herders and trekkers, who were trapped in a heavy snowstorm that began on Friday.
titles: Hundreds of hikers rescued from Mount Everest after severe snowstorm
Hundreds of Everest hikers reach safety after snowstorm in Tibetan valley
summary: Approximately 900 individuals, including hikers, guides, yak herders, and staff, stranded by a weekend snowstorm on the Chinese side of Mount Everest, were safely rescued by late Tuesday. The group, caught in a heavy snowstorm starting Friday, has now reached safety, according to state media reports.

title: Israel Intercepts Gaza-Bound Boats; Diplomats Work on Gaza Plan; Crew Member Die
snippets: Israel attacks and intercepts another convoy of Gaza-bound boats, according to the Freedom Flotilla Coalition.

Qatari PM and US’s Witkoff and Kushner join Hamas and Israeli negotiators working on Trump’s Gaza plan

A Filipino crew member of a Dutch cargo ship has died from injuries sustained in an attack by Houthi rebels in the Gulf of Aden</
titles: LIVE: Israel keeps bombing Gaza as ceasefire talks in Egypt enter third day
Gaza ceasefire talks live: US, Turkey and Qatar join efforts as negotiations enter third day
summary: Israel intercepted a convoy of boats bound for Gaza, as reported by the Freedom Flotilla Coalition. Meanwhile, Qatari PM, US's Witkoff, and Kushner are collaborating with Hamas and Israeli negotiators on Trump's Gaza plan. Additionally, a Filipino crew member of a Dutch cargo ship died from injuries after a Houthi rebel attack in the Gulf of Aden.

title: Louisiana Police Release Video of Fatal Crash Involving Ex-LSU Player Lacy
snippets: Louisiana State Police released video and records related to a fatal crash in December 2024 they allege was caused by ex-LSU football player Kyren Lacy.
Lacy's attorney claimed police misrepresented the late LSU football star's involvement in the Dec. 2024 collision
titles: Police: Lacy's driving set off events in fatal crash
Louisiana State Police: Evidence shows Kyren Lacy's 'reckless' driving led to events that caused fatal crash
summary: Louisiana State Police released video and records of a fatal crash in December 2024, attributing the cause to former LSU football player Kyren Lacy. However, Lacy's attorney disputes the police's portrayal of Lacy's involvement in the incident, suggesting a misrepresentation.

title: Mariners' Raleigh Gifts Bat to Fan After ALDS Game 3 Win Over Tigers
snippets: After the game, Cal Raleigh posed alongside the fan with an autographed bat to say thanks.

They say never meet your heroes, but sometimes fate has other plans. While the Seattle Mariners were busy celebrating an 8-4 win over the Detroit Tigers in Game 3 of their ALDS matchup — to take a 2-1 series lead — one fan got a couple more reasons to cheer.
titles: 'Dump 61 Here': Raleigh meets fan who caught his home run ball
Mariners fan sporting ‘Dump 61 here’ shirt catches homer, meets Raleigh
summary: Following the Seattle Mariners' 8-4 victory over the Detroit Tigers in Game 3 of their ALDS matchup, securing a 2-1 series lead, Cal Raleigh, a player from the Mariners, expressed gratitude to a fan by posing for a photo and gifting an autographed bat.

title: Additional Envoys Join Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Talks in Egypt
snippets: Additional representatives from mediating countries have joined the Israel-Hamas ceasefire talks in Egypt. Another aid flotilla says it has been intercepted by the Israeli navy. DW has more.

White House says it is important ‘that we get this done quickly’ as indirect talks restart in Sharm el-Sheikh

A US delegation led by envoy Steve Witkoff is expected to join talks in Egypt on Wednesday to reinforce President Donald Trump’s involvement in the newly restarted negotiations betw
titles: Middle East: US, Turkey, Qatar envoys arrive for Gaza talks
US delegation led by Steve Witkoff due to arrive in Egypt for Gaza talks
summary: Mediating countries have sent additional representatives to join the Israel-Hamas ceasefire talks in Egypt, aiming for a swift resolution. A new aid flotilla reports interception by the Israeli navy. The US, emphasizing urgency, has dispatched a delegation led by envoy Steve Witkoff to support the negotiations, highlighting President Trump's commitment to the process.

title: Israeli Military Intercepts Gaza-Bound Aid Flotilla; Activists to Be Deported

Israeli foreign ministry confirms interception and says those on board will be deported

A new Gaza-bound aid flotilla has been intercepted by the Israeli army, days after the detention of activists on board vessels bound for the war-torn territory caused
titles: Israel intercepts Freedom Flotilla Coalition vessels en route to Gaza
Israel intercepts another Gaza aid flotilla amid criticism over treatment of activists
summary: The Israeli military intercepted and boarded a Gaza-bound aid flotilla, days after detaining activists on similar vessels. The Israeli foreign ministry confirmed the interception, stating those on board will be deported.

title: Pat Cummins Likely to Miss Ashes Opener Due to Back Injury
snippets: Cummins will all but definitely miss the first Ashes Test as his entire series is clouded with doubt

• Australia captain set to be ruled out of opener against England in Perth

  • Star quick yet to return to bowling as he recovers from back injury

Australia captain Pat Cummins is expected to miss the Ashes opener in Perth as doubts grow around his availability fo
titles: Pat Cummins set to miss start of Ashes and could be absent for whole series
Pat Cummins expected to miss first Ashes Test as doubts grow over fitness for entire series
summary: Australia's cricket captain, Pat Cummins, is likely to miss the opening Ashes Test in Perth due to a back injury that has prevented him from returning to bowling. His participation in the entire series is uncertain as he continues to recover.

title: Conor McGregor Suspended 18 Months for Doping Policy Violation
snippets: McGregor has been hit with a backdated ban after missing three drug tests

• Former champion missed three tests last year

  • Irishman could return for 2026 bout at White House

Conor McGregor has been handed an 18-month suspension for violating the UFC’s anti-doping policy after missing three attempted tests last year, Combat Sports Anti
titles: When can Conor McGregor fight again after receiving UFC anti-doping ban?
Conor McGregor given 18-month ban for breaking UFC’s anti-doping rules
summary: Conor McGregor received an 18-month backdated suspension for missing three drug tests last year, violating UFC's anti-doping policy. This suspension allows him to return to fighting potentially by 2026, with discussions of a bout at the White House.

title: EU Plans to Double UK Steel Tariff, Matching Trump's Rates
snippets: The EU is the destination for 78% of steel products made in the UK for overseas markets.

Starmer says UK in discussions with EU over Brussels plan to double import tariff to 50%, which unions warn could kill UK steel industry

The EU has announced it will match Donald Trump’s steel tariffs, doubling levies on imports to 50% in a decision condemned as “an existential threat” to t
titles: EU steel tariff hike threatens 'biggest ever crisis' for UK industry
EU plan to match Trump steel tariffs spurs ‘existential threat’ to UK steel industry
summary: The EU, receiving 78% of the UK's overseas steel exports, plans to double its import tariff to 50%, matching former US President Trump's rates. UK's Labour leader, Starmer, confirms discussions with the EU about this increase, which unions fear could devastate the UK steel industry.

title: Panthers Eye Third Stanley Cup, Oilers Seek First in Fierce Contest
snippets: The Panthers are the big dogs in the Eastern Conference, but bringing home a third straight Stanley Cup may be even more difficult than winning the first two.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMijwFBVV95cUxQODRrWVVhc2wtaldqQ3djZy1VMlNDamJMbmxCNEN6eTlnR2c1QmVnSnZVVVZGRklqMFZRQVB4bEluWHdONE5DRDJTNFVNTmxaZjZEdTNQRzVwcTZGUVlOZFRROFJieWc1VVlyXzBLcXAyeVdHaWFyX1BEdmpPZFhVMjlaZVlFQ0lmZlZFOVNiRQ?oc=5" target="_blank">Panthers open 2nd straight Stanle

Panthers open 2nd straight Stanley Cup defense with win against Blackhawks - NHL.com
summary: The Panthers, leading in the Eastern Conference, aim for a third consecutive Stanley Cup, a feat recognized as challenging. Meanwhile, the Oilers express strong motivation to claim their first Stanley Cup victory. Both teams are currently in contention, highlighting the competitive nature of the tournament.

title: 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics Awarded for Quantum Tech Advances
snippets: The 2025 Nobel prize in physics has gone to John Clarke, Michel Devoret and John Martinis, whose work has led to the development of today's quantum computers
John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret, and John Martinis built an electrical circuit-based oscillator on a microchip.
titles: Nobel prize for physics goes to trio behind quantum computing chips
2025 Nobel Prize in Physics awarded for macroscale quantum tunneling
summary: John Clarke, Michel Devoret, and John Martinis were awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics for their pioneering work in quantum mechanics, specifically advancing the development of quantum technology, including quantum computers, cryptography, and sensors. Their research has been crucial in demonstrating how quantum mechanics' properties can have practical applications in technology. The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences in Stockholm announced the award, highlighting the trio's contributions as foundational to digital technology's future.

title: Intercontinental Invests $2B in Polymarket, Stock Rises 3% in Premarket
snippets: Intercontinental Exchange rose more than 3% in the premarket after the company announced it took a $2 billion stake in prediction markets platform Polymarket.
The investment follows a previous venture round that reportedly valued the prediction market at more than $1 billion.
titles: NYSE-owner Intercontinental Exchange rises after it takes $2 billion stake in Polymarket
New York Stock Exchange parent company invests $2 billion in Polymarket at $9 billion valuation
summary: Intercontinental Exchange announced a $2 billion investment in Polymarket, a prediction markets platform founded by Shayne Coplan. Following the announcement, Intercontinental's stock rose over 3% in premarket trading.
